isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SKIRT PANELS, AERO SIDE SKIRT PANELS, BODY AIR DEFLECTORS, BUMPERS AND ROOFS - 0. ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR - PRO SLEEPER® AERODYNAMIC DEFLECTOR

svcsubproc.title: Low Roof
svcsubproc.para: In July, 1994 International introduced a flat top and high roof PRO SLEEPER®. The roof deflector assembly for each tractor will be shipped to the dealer directly from the deflector manufacturer unpainted. It will be the dealer's responsibility to paint and install the roof deflector assembly.

step1.para: Prepare the outer surface of the air deflector and air deflector extenders for painting as explained in GROUP 16- CAB, Painting in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Paint the air deflector and side deflectors the finish color before installation. The inside of the air deflector and back side of the air deflector extenders and the antenna mount (if included) do not require a class 1 finish.
Also paint the 8 star bolt assemblies, and 2 "L" brackets the finish color.

Completely cover the roof of the cab with blankets or tarps to protect the roof from being damaged during the installation procedure. Also cover the air horn(s). Care must be taken not to damage the air horn(s) during the air deflector installation.

Remove the cab drag link airshield brace
from the air deflector middle and rear mounting brackets on both sides of the vehicle. Re-install the bolt that secures the middle mount to the cab roof. Tighten finger tight.
Position the air deflector on the air deflector front mounting bracket tabs, then slide the air deflector back against the air deflector rear mounting brackets .
Re-install the cab drag link airshield brace between the middle mounting bracket and the air deflector . Install and tighten the bolt on the middle mount finger tight.

Install two 3/8"x 1-1/2" hex hd. bolts and 3/8" flat washers through the two holes in the air deflector rear mounting bracket, through the rear of the air deflector and cab drag link airshield brace on both sides of the vehicle
. Install a 3/8" nylon lock nut and 3/8" flat washer on each bolt. Tighten the lock nuts until they are snug and the air deflector is against both air deflector rear mounting brackets.

With the air deflector resting on the front mounting tabs, measure the clearance between the front of the air deflector and the cab roof. The clearance across the front should be 3/4 of an inch
. If it's not close to 3/4 of an inch, block the front of the air deflector up to obtain the correct clearance. Be sure the measurement is the same across the front of the air deflector.

note.para:
If you plan on installing more than one set of PRO SLEEPER air deflector assemblies, it is recommended that metal templates be made from the drawings
.

step1.para:
Place the drilling templates
, in position on the tabs of the air deflector front mounting bracket as illustrated
. Be sure the slot in the template is resting on the tab
. Tape the template in this position.
Drill a 1/8 inch pilot hole through the air deflector in both positions indicated on the template.
Remove the template and drill a 13/32 inch hole through the air deflector in both pilot hole locations.
Care should be taken not to damage the threads in the air deflector front mounting bracket when the drill passes through the fiberglass material of the air deflector.

Install a 3/8" x 1-3/4" Star Drive bolt assembly in both holes and tighten finger tight
. If the bolts are difficult to install, run a 3/8"- 16 tap in the holes to clean up the threads.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. FLAT WASHER AND NYLON INSERT LOCK NUT

step1.para: Repeat Steps 9 through 12 on the opposite side of the vehicle.

Be sure the middle mounting bracket is against the inside of the air deflector and use the 1/8" pilot drill to drill a hole (from the inside) at each bolt hole location in both air deflector middle mounting brackets
.
From the outside of the air deflector, drill a 13/32" hole at each 1/8" pilot hole location.

Install, from the outside, a 3/8" x 1-3/4" Star Drive bolt assembly through the air deflector and mounting bracket. Secure with a flat washer and 3/8"-16 nylon insert lock nut
.
Tighten all air deflector front and middle Star Drive bolt assemblies and the middle mounting bracket mounting bolt to 31 ft-lbs. (42 N•m).

Remove the two 3/8 inch bolts from the rear mounting bracket, through the rear of the deflector
.

Position the right air deflector extender to the right rear of the roof of air deflector so the bottom two holes in the side deflector line up with the two lower holes in the air deflector rear mounting bracket.
Re-install the two 3/8 inch bolts, flat washers and nuts removed in Step 1 in these holes.

Position the side deflector so it is flush with the side and top of the roof air deflector
. Hold in place with a "C" clamp
. Tighten the two lower nuts to 31 ft-lbs. (42 N•m).
Use the holes in the mounting flange of the air deflector extender as a template and a drill a 11/32 inch hole through the roof air deflector at each hole location .

From the air deflector extender side, install a 5/16" x 1" hex hd. bolt and 5/16 inch flat washer through each hole. Install a 5/16 inch flat washer and nylon insert lock nut on each bolt
. Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m). Remove the "C" clamp.
Repeat the Steps 1 through 6 on the left air deflector extender.

Position the "L" bracket on the inside of the lower air deflector and up against the bottom of the air deflector extender as illustrated
. Secure in place with two 5/16" - 18 x 1" hex hd bolts and 5/16" lock washers. Tighten hand tight.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. 5/16"-18 x 1" HEX HD BOLT, 5/16" FLAT WASHER, LOCK WASHER AND NUT
3. 5/16"-18 x 1" HEX HD. BOLT, 5/16" LOCK WASHER AND NUT

step1.para:
Use the hole on the side of the "L" bracket that is against the bottom of the upper air deflector extender as a guide to drill an 11/32" hole through the bottom of the upper side mounted air deflector. Secure the "L" bracket to the upper air deflector extender with a 5/16"-18 x 1" hex hd. bolt, flat washer, lock washer and hex nut
through this hole with the head of the bolt and a flat washer against the upper air deflector extender. Tighten the fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).
Remove the 7th and 8th bolts (from the bottom going up) that secure the air deflector extender to the roof air deflector and discard.

Place antenna mount against side deflector and align with the holes of the bolts removed in Step 1
.
Install a 5/16" x 1-1/4" hex hd. bolt and 5/16" flat washer through these holes into the roof air deflector. Install a 5/16" flat washer and locknut on each bolt . Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Drill an 11/32" hole through the roof air deflector using the outermost hole in the antenna mount as a guide
. Install a 5/16" x 1-1/4" hex hd. bolt and 5/16" flat washer through this hole into the roof air deflector. Install a 5/16" flat washer and lock nut on the bolt. Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Drill two 11/32" holes through the side air deflector extender using the holes in the antenna mount that contact the air deflector extender as a guide
. Install 5/16" x 1-1/4" button hd. capscrews and 5/16" flat washers through the holes in the air deflector extender into the antenna mount. Install 5/16" flat washers and lock nuts on the bolts. Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Remove the 5th 5/16" bolt from the bottom that secures the air deflector extender to the roof air deflector
.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. 5/16"-18 x 1-1/4" ON 72", 5/16" x 1 2" ON 51" HEX HD. BOLT, FLAT WASHER

step1.para: Secure the top of the brace to the bottom of the antenna mount in the hole provided with a 5/16" x 1-1/4" hex hd bolt on a 72" and 5/16" x 2" hex hd. bolt and a spacer on a 51", 2 flat washers and lock nut .

Install the bottom of the antenna mount brace to the air deflector extender in the hole where the bolt was removed, with the bolt removed in Step 6
. Tighten both bolts to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. 5/16" x 1-1/4" ON 72", 5/16" x 2" ON 51", HEX HD BOLT, 2 FLAT WASHERS AND LOCK NUT

step1.para: Install antenna to antenna mount per antenna manufacturer's instructions.
Run cable using "P" clamps or wire ties as required to insure that they do not vibrate, especially next to the antenna plugs.
Check antenna operation per manufacturer's instructions.

Hold the flexible cab trim molding in position against the rear edge of the air deflector extender assembly
.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. #10 FLAT WASHER, HEX NYLON INSERT LOCK NUT

step1.para:
Install No.10 fasteners starting from the center and working out toward each end as illustrated
. Snug up each fastener. Align the forward edge of the flexible molding flush with the outside trailing edge of the air deflector extender assembly.
Tighten all fasteners from the center out to 6 ft-lbs. (8 N•m). Do not over tighten as distortion of the flexible molding and retainer may result.

svcsubproc.title: Drilling Templates
svcsubproc.para: It will be necessary to create metal templates to use as a guide to drill the front bracket mounting holes in the air deflector . One template can be made using the right side measurements. Reverse the right template to use it on the left side.

step1.para:
Remove the 5/16"-18 torx hd capscrews installed around the high roof
.

Carefully set the roof air deflector on the roof so that the holes in the air deflector line up with the holes in the roof
.

caution.para: Care should be taken not to mar the paint on the roof during air deflector installation.

step1.para: Re-install the 5/16"-18 torx hd. capscrews that were removed in Step 1 to secure the air deflector to the roof . Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Install the left and right flexible cab trim molding to the rear of both air deflector extenders. Position the flexible trim flush with the top of the air deflector extender. Secure the trim in position with one #10-16 x 1-1/4" self-tapping pan hd screw in the center of the molding. Tighten the screw to 6 ft-lbs. (8 N•m). DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN.

Hold the air deflector extender in position against the back of the roof air deflector with "C" clamps. Position the extender so it is even with the top and flush with the outer edge of the roof air deflector.
Use the three holes in the extender as template and drill 11/32" holes through the roof air deflector in these locations.

Secure the air deflector extender to the back of the roof deflector
with three 5/16"-18 x 1-1/4" bolts, 5/16" flat washers, special washers and lock nuts in the three drilled holes as illustrated in view B-B. Tighten the fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m). Repeat this procedure on the opposite side of the roof air deflector.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Air Deflector and Extender Bracket Alignment

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. VIEW SECTION A-A A. ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR B. 5/16"-18 x 1-1/4" SST HEX HD. BOLT C. 5/16" SST FLAT WASHER D. ROOF DEFLECTOR EXTENDER BRACE E. SPECIAL SST FLAT WASHER F. 5/16" HEX LOCK NUT CAD PLATED
4. VIEW SECTION C-C A. 5/16"-18 x 1-1/4" SST HEX HD BOLT B. 5/16" SST FLAT WASHER C. AIR DEFLECTOR EXTENDER D. HEX LOCK NUT CAD PLATED E. ROOF DEFLECTOR EXTENDER BRACE
5. VIEW SECTION B-B A. AIR DEFLECTOR EXTENDER B. 5/16"-18 x 1-1/4" SST HEX HD. BOLT C. 5/16 SST FLAT WASHER D. SPECIAL SST FLAT WASHER E. HEX LOCK NUT CAD PLATED F. ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR
8. VIEW IN DIRECTION OF "D" A. AIR DEFLECTOR EXTENDER B. SIDE REAR UPPER AIR DEFLECTOR MOUNTING SUPPORT C. 5/16"-18 x 1" SST HEX HD BOLT AND 5/16" LOCK WASHER (4)
9. 5/16"-18 x 1" SST HEX HD BOLT AND 5/16" LOCK WASHER (4)

step1.para:
Install the roof fairing extender brace between the rear of the roof air deflector and the air deflector extender as illustrated in views A-A and C-C
. Tighten fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Install the side rear upper air deflector mounting brackets between the upper and lower side mounted air deflectors with 5/16"-18 x 1" SST hex hd. bolts and 5/16" lock washers as illustrated in view "D"
. Tighten all fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

At the lower end of the angle bracket on the air deflector extender is a hole. Make sure the lower end of the extender is flush with the outside of the roof air deflector and install a #10-16 x 1-1/4" self tapping pan head screw in this hole, into the back of the fiberglass roof. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
. DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN.
Repeat this procedure on the opposite side of the roof deflector.
